author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy has said that a total of 1,605 child workers were rescued from various industries in the past three years and education was provided to them.

Addressing a two-day training programme on anti-child labour and prevention of child marriages here on Tuesday, he said that the National Child Labour Project (NCLP) aims at rescuing children and provide them rehabilitation measures. “So far 1,605 child workers were rescued and education was being provided to them”, he added.

The Collector said that of this, 247 children were rescued from industries while others were rescued from shops, poultry farms and from commercial establishments. “Assistance of Rs. 72,000 is deposited in their bank account for their education and social welfare and protection”, he added.

The Collector said that children after admitted in regular schools are monitored continuously so that they continue their education and not back as workers.

In the recent years, children were rescued from brick kiln units, lorry body building workshops and from poultry farms in large numbers. They were admitted to special schools run under the NCLP and later admitted to regular schools.
title: 1,605 child workers rescued in Namakkal in three years
